overview: The Azure Local Integration Architecture serves as a baseline reference for integrating on-premises resources with Azure services, focusing on management, scalability, and security. It encompasses a control plane for resource management, hosting traditional applications, and containerized applications, while ensuring secure connectivity through firewalls and validated hardware.

components.name: Control Plane
components.description: Manages resources through Azure Portal, Azure CLI, and various Azure services.
security_considerations: Implement role-based access control (RBAC) to restrict access.
Regularly audit access logs for suspicious activity.
Ensure all management interfaces are secured with MFA.
components.data_handling: Management data is processed and stored securely.
components.encryption_status: Data encrypted in transit and at rest.
vulnerabilities: Potential misconfiguration leading to unauthorized access

components.name: Azure Local Instance
components.description: Hosts traditional applications and Arc VMs managed through Hyper-V.
security_considerations: Ensure Hyper-V is updated with the latest security patches.
Isolate VMs using network security groups.
Use Azure Security Center for continuous security assessment.
components.encryption_status: Data encrypted at rest using BitLocker.

components.name: Kubernetes-based Applications
components.description: Utilizes Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) for container orchestration.
security_considerations: Implement network policies to control traffic flow.
Use Azure Policy to enforce compliance on AKS resources.
Regularly scan container images for vulnerabilities.
components.data_handling: Handles application data and user requests.
components.encryption_status: Data encrypted in transit using TLS.

components.name: Validated Hardware
components.description: Consists of Azure Local machines connected via ToR switches.
security_considerations: Regularly update firmware on networking equipment.
components.data_handling: Handles data traffic between Azure Local machines.

components.name: Corporate Firewall
components.description: Secures outbound access to required URL endpoints.
security_considerations: Regularly update firewall rules based on threat intelligence.
Implement logging and monitoring for firewall traffic.
Conduct periodic penetration testing to assess firewall effectiveness.

trust_boundaries.name: On-Premises to Azure Boundary
recommendations: Regularly review and update firewall policies.
